HOOK: Your listing descriptions are losing you showings before buyers even call. [ON-SCREEN: Your listings sound like everyone else's]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You spend hours writing listing descriptions, but they all sound the same. "Updated kitchen, spacious bedrooms, move-in ready." Buyers scroll right past because nothing grabs them. [ON-SCREEN: "Updated kitchen, spacious bedrooms"] You're competing with thousands of agents using the exact same tired phrases.
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what I discovered when I built an AI tool that thinks like a bestselling novelist.

INSIGHT: Instead of telling the AI to write like a real estate agent, I gave it a different identity: "You're a bestselling novelist and an award-winning investigative journalist." [ON-SCREEN: Novelist + Journalist = Better listings] A novelist knows sensory details. A journalist leads with story, not specs. So instead of "updated kitchen," it writes "the kind of kitchen where Sunday mornings stretch into afternoons." [ON-SCREEN: "Sunday mornings stretch into afternoons"] Instead of "spacious master," it writes "a bedroom that feels like your own private retreat." The AI started creating descriptions that sound like places people actually want to live.

REFRAME: Most agents write listings like they're checking compliance boxes. Top producers write them like the opening chapter of a book buyers can't put down. [ON-SCREEN: Form vs. Story] You can do this today without any AI tool.

CLOSE: "See you next time."
